New Records: Heinrich Klaasen scored the second quickest hundred in this tournament, after compatriot Aiden Markram’s 100 off 48 balls against Sri Lanka.
South Africa scored the second-highest total in the tournament with 399-7.
South Africa also scored 428-5 – the highest – against Sri Lanka in New Delhi.
Key Match Events: England fell to 38-4 after 8.1 overs in their reply and were eventually dismissed for 170 in only 22 overs.
Klaasen and Jansen toyed with England’s pace and spin to put on 151 as the Proteas notched up the second-highest total in the tournament.
After conceding their highest total in ODIs, England were dismissed with 28 overs to spare in its heaviest defeat by runs in ODIs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The defeat left England with a mountain to climb to reach the semifinals, with skipper Jos Buttler admitting, “It leaves us with no room for error.”
Others: Sri Lanka finally got their first win by beating the Netherlands by five wickets in Lucknow, India.
